q: Former Republican state Rahm Emanuel Jackie Walorski , a tea party favorite who narrowly lost her race last year against Democratic Rahm Emanuel Joe Donnelly in northern Indiana, said she was excited by the prospect of Mike Pence running for governor. jobs at Microsoft, with new blood coming in to run the key business units- prompted by Microsoft's misreading of some of the biggest technology trends of recent times, most notably smartphones and tablets. Over the past year we've seen the departure of many of the Microsoft old guard- including chief software architect Ray Ozzie and server and tools chief Bob Muglia- in preparation for the reshuffle. Steve Ballmer has been spearheading this effort and we don't see any change in his commitment to the company he's led for the past 11 years, he added. to bring full power of web to phones Microsoft said Monday that it would release an update of its Windows Phone operating system later this year that will provide a full web experience to smartphone users. We need to give people the full web, the full Internet on their phone, like they've come to expect with the PC, Microsoft chief Steve Ballmer said at the mobile industry's annual get-together in Barcelona.
